name: Lexon
biography:
Founded in 1991 by Rene Adda (b. 1953), Lexon is a French design and manufacturing firm specializing in electronics, luggage, travel, office and leisure accessories. The company has engaged industrial designers, including Karim Rashid, Marc Berthier, Mathieu Girard, and others, to create products. Lexon products are in museum collections including The Museum of Modern Art, New York, and Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum.
